GSD.description: ** DISPUTED **  os-prober in os-prober 1.17 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the (1) /tmp/mounted-map or (2) /tmp/raided-map temporary file.  NOTE: the vendor disputes this issue, stating "the insecure code path should only ever run inside a d-i environment, which has no non-root users."

reference_data.name: [debian-devel] 20080811 Re: Possible mass bug filing: The possibility of attack with the help of symlinks in some Debian packages
[debian-devel] 20080811 Re: Possible mass bug filing: The possibility of attack with the help of symlinks in some Debian packages

descriptions.value: os-prober in os-prober 1.17 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the (1) /tmp/mounted-map or (2) /tmp/raided-map temporary file.  NOTE: the vendor disputes this issue, stating "the insecure code path should only ever run inside a d-i environment, which has no non-root users.

** CUESTIONADA ** os-prober de os-prober v1.17, permite a usuarios locales sobrescribir ficheros de su elección mediante un ataque de enlace simbólico en los ficheros temporales (1) /tmp/mounted-map or (2) /tmp/raided-map. NOTA: El vendedor ha impugnado esta vulnerabilidad, argumentando que "la ruta del código no seguro, sólo tendría que ejecutarse en un entorno d-i sin permisos de administrador"
